page.title: 07ROXWELL PARISH CHURCH(CONT)
page.content: The Parish Church of St.Michaels and All Angels at Roxwell had Robert Dowton as its first vicar. There is a plaque on the North wall naming all of the vicars and the present one is Rev. M.T.Practor. On the west wal there is a carving of the Last Supper and above it a plaque in remembrance of Douglas Montague, a village notable. The font is in the west of the church and the altar is in the east. It is very decorative with the organ and pews for the choir and nearby the wooden pulpit. Nearby is the memorial for Wilfred Christy who owned Christy Farm near Roxwell.
